meanings.definition: To surpass in shaming or embarrassing someone.
meanings.sent1: She outshames her classmates by always getting the highest grades.
meanings.sent2: The talented singer outshames all others with her beautiful voice.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey outshames the zookeeper by stealing his hat and wearing it.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outshames the darkness, bringing light to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sun outshames all the stars in the sky with its radiant glow.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel shame or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: His thoughtless comment outshames his friend, making her feel embarrassed.
meanings.sent2: The prank outshames him, leaving him red-faced in front of his peers.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter outshames the comedian by slipping on a banana peel mid-performance.
meanings.sent4: The truth outshames all lies, revealing the reality behind the facade.
meanings.sent5: Her apology outshames any wrongdoing, showing true remorse and sincerity.
